result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:34 AM Defendant Caden D. Lindner in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Caden D. Lindner.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim John Doe in court.  All parties appeared in person in Richland County.  Attorney Amy Riva Blumenfeld Bogost appeared by video for John Doe.  State recites joint recommendation:  amend to Misd Battery 940.19(1).  DPA -  24 mo .  Guilty plea given/entered.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and defers sentence accordingly.
No contact with victim, B.B., the victim's family or their residence(s).  Also, no third party contact with the victim, the victim's family or thier residence(s).

2:32 PM Defendant Caden D. Lindner in court.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day in court for Caden D. Lindner.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amy Riva Blumenfeld Bogost in court for John Doe.   Atty Meyer-O'Day requests motion for recusal be denied.  Court makes record of arguments of motion to recuse.  Motion to recuse is denied and gives basis.
Jury Trial scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Defendant and his counsel may appear in Richland County for this hearing.

1:36 PM Defendant Caden D. Lindner in court.  Attorney Amy Riva Blumenfeld Bogost appeared by phone for John Doe.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day appeared by video for Caden D. Lindner.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed.  Court verbally reviews charges/penalties with the defendant. Waiver of formal reading of complaint. Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Motion for recusal has been filed.  Court requests filing of briefs in regards this motion.  DA's brief to be filed by 08/19/2022.  Atty Bogost to respond by 09/09/2022.  Atty Meyer-O'Day requests a shorter turn around and gives basis; Court amends briefing scheduled.  Atty Meyer-O'Day will file further motions as soon as possible.
